title: Quick Shoot Production from Sweet Potato

tasks.task: Demonstrate slip production (shoot production) from sweet potatoes
subtasks: Collect three types of sweet potatoes (yellow, purple, white varieties)
Cut sweet potatoes into two sections using a knife
Insert toothpicks into each cut section for anchoring in water
Place cut sections in water cups, maintaining 1 cm depth of water
Monitor water level daily and add water as needed
Wait 1-2 weeks for shoots to develop; check progress weekly
When shoots reach 8-10 cm, remove them from mother roots
Separate shoots and place in new water cups for rooting
Wait 1 week for new roots to form on separated shoots
Transplant rooted shoots into main field or desired medium

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Demonstrate slip production (shoot production) from sweet potatoes
subtasks: Collect three types of sweet potatoes (yellow, purple, white varieties)
Cut each sweet potato into two sections using a knife
Insert three toothpicks into each cut section for anchoring in water
Place cut sections in water cups, maintaining 1 cm depth of water
Monitor water level daily and add water as needed
Check progress weekly for shoot development (after one week)
Carefully remove shoots when they reach 8-10 cm in length
Transfer each shoot to a new water cup for rooting
Check new cups daily, ensuring water depth of at least 1 cm
After one week, transplant rooted shoots to main field or growing medium
